revisionDesc.change: Vote - Accept-Straight-to-Finalization - The readings of the ed. pr. shoulδ be preferred, unless the modifications are entereδ as PN corrections. Accordingly: l1: => τεσσαρεσκ̣[αι] l1-2: add num tag l8: => ἐδάνε̣ι[σ-] (The editor indicates (I believe) that it cannot be decided if the singular or the plural was written. So edaneisen or edaneisan.)

Text from printed edition. In line 1 the photo doesn't have any traces of κ in τεσσαρεσκ[αι-] and therefore I've changed it to τεσσαρεσ[και-]. The same goes for line 8, where there are no traces of ι in ἐδανει[σ- and therefore I've changed it to ἑδάνε[ισεν. What's more, the form form ἐδάνεισ- instead of the usual ἐδάνεισεν before a vowel seems grammatically unfitting in my opinion. Therefore, I've preferred to correct it to ἑδάνεισεν and close the square brackets.

div.ab:

Κλαυδίου Καίσαρος
Σεβαστοῦ Γερμανικοῦ
Αὐτοκράτορος μη
νὸς Σεβαστοῦ. ἐν Ὀ
ξυρύγχων πόλει
τῆς Θηβαΐδος. ἐδάνεισ-
Ἀπολλώνιος Απ
ειδ
